message.name: A1
message.say: Jordan and

message.name: A2
message.say: , unfortunately neither of you are correct.

message.name: A3
message.say: No sorry Jordan and

message.name: A4
message.say: , neither of you are correct.

message.name: A5
message.say: Choose an answer please!

message.name: A6
message.say: , you are really getting this!

message.name: A7
message.say: , you are correct! Great job!

message.name: A8
message.say: Excellent

message.name: A9
message.say: , can you please click on the correct answer choice?

message.name: A10
message.say: That is not right.

message.name: A11
message.say: Please try again.

message.name: A12
message.say: Great Jordan and

message.name: A13
message.say: Jordan and

message.name: A14
message.say: , you are both correct!

message.name: A15
message.say: Excellent the both of you!

message.name: A16
message.say: Jordan and

message.name: A17
message.say: , you are both going to become great writers one day!

message.name: A18
message.say: Both of your answers are correct!

message.name: A19
message.say: Jordan, can you answer this question?

message.name: A20
message.say: , can you please choose one and drag it to the blank?

message.name: A21
message.say: Jordan, you are correct!

message.name: A22
message.say: Jordan, you are right on this one!

message.name: A23
message.say: Jordan, your answer is correct!

message.name: A24
message.say: What an exciting story. You used your knowledge of how narrative texts are arranged to create your own story! I hope you enjoyed this activity.

message.name: A25
message.say: Hi Jordan and

message.name: A26
message.say: , it's Cristina once again to tell you about the activities.

message.name: A27
message.say: In this activity, you will answer questions about basic plot structure in narrative texts. After each question you will be given a piece of a story. You can fill in the blanks of the story to create your own version.

message.name: A28
message.say: Great! In order to fill in the blanks, you will click one of the button options and drag that option to a blank area in the sentence. When the line under the blank turns green, you will know that your answer can be dropped into the sentence.

message.name: A29
message.say: Let's start developing the beginning of your story. What is one element that needs to be introduced in the beginning of your story? Please click on either A, B, or C.

message.name: A30
message.say: The correct answer is A. whenever you tell a story, you need to introduce the characters.

message.name: A31
message.say: Now that you know how to begin your story, you can start by choosing two characters from the list below and drag them to the blanks. The two characters you choose will be your story's main characters

message.name: A32
message.say: Good selection Jordan and

message.name: A33
message.say: , these two will be your story's main characters. Now let's continue building your story!

message.name: A34
message.say: Choose an answer

message.name: A35
message.say: Jordan and

message.name: A36
message.say: , what element describes when and where a story takes place? This element may change. Please click on either A, B, or C next to the correct answer choice. Please click on either A, B, or C.

message.name: A37
message.say: The correct answer is B. You need to establish the setting early on in the story, but the setting may change a lot as the story progresses.

message.name: A38
message.say: Now that you know that you need to establish the setting, Jordan and

message.name: A39
message.say: , please choose a setting with a time and a place from the list below and drag them to the blanks.

message.name: A40
message.say: Nice settings Jordan and

message.name: A41
message.say: , you two are being very creative!

message.name: A42
message.say: Now that you two have chosen a setting, let's continue. Jordan and

message.name: A43
message.say: , what is the element of a story that creates conflict for the characters? Please click on either A, B, or C.

message.name: A44
message.say: The correct answer is A. In the beginning of the story, there typically is a problem.

message.name: A45
message.say: Now that you know that you must introduce a problem at the beginning of the story,

message.name: A46
message.say: , please choose a problem from the list below and drag it to the blank.

message.name: A47
message.say: Interesting problem! Let's go on.

message.name: A48
message.say: There has been a lot of events so far in the story! Jordan and

message.name: A49
message.say: , what happens at the most important point of the story? Please click on either A, B, or C.

message.name: A50
message.say: The correct answer is C. when something happens that complicates the problem it leads up to a major event.

message.name: A51
message.say: Now, we know that you must have a major event follow the problem,

message.name: A52
message.say: , let's read the middle of the story, choose a major event from the list below and drag it to the blank.

message.name: A53
message.say: Great choice of major event

message.name: A54
message.say: ! Let's move on to the ending of your story.

message.name: A55
message.say: Jordan and

message.name: A56
message.say: , can you tell me what happens at the end of a story? Please click on either A, B, or C.

message.name: A57
message.say: The correct answer is A, the ending of the story is where the problem is finally solved.

message.name: A58
message.say: Now that you know what the ending of a story is,

message.name: A59
message.say: , we need an ending for your story. Please select an ending and drag it to the blank.

message.name: A60
message.say: Great ending and a good way to resolve the story's problem!

message.name: A61
message.say: You know what I think will make this story even better

message.name: A62
message.say: and Jordan? A title!

message.name: A63
message.say: , why don't you give the story a title?

message.name: A64
message.say: Before we look at your finished story, let's come up with a title for it!
